properties.description: Add another bar/restaurants but make it nice and classy and not so rundown.
It would be really nice to have a big movie theater like the one off Zebulon.
College and Forsyth. New small businesses and restaurants near to Mercer's Campus.
I need more late-night food options that are accessible to college students. We are willing to spend the money if it's available to us when we go out. Must be within walking distance.
Pleasant Hill would be an area for housing development of new single-family housing due to walking distance to downtown Macon, easy access to interstate highway I-75 and I-16.
Late-night dessert/coffee shop.
Clothing stores/boutiques.
More security. More places to shop and walk around.
Sports bar/restaurant downtown. Restaurant during day hours, lounge at night.
Poplar Street restoration, especially all those abandoned buildings.

I would spend money at restaurants, entertainment, shops and bars going down 3rd and on Plum if there were options. I feel Cherry, Poplar, and corresponding areas on 2nd and 3rd have been doing well and now it is time to expand a block down.
Better housing for residents.
I would like improvements on the corner of the Massee as well as better lighting along Cherry St.
Plant trees in G. Bernd Park for shade and home for organisms.
Fix up potholes
Rose Hill Cemetery. Very nice to vist and run in, but needs road work and many repairs to steps, paths, and grave sites.
Create a safe way for people on Cherry to enjoy nightlife, entertainment, & safe housing
I would add shopping centers and strip malls, but add other stores in there such as finance places or gathering/community-focused centers.

Host events and bring back more greenery (trees etc). The park already has plenty of tennis courts. The money to help in hosting tournaments for tennis and the profits could go to helping out the community. One tournament is already being planned to help save money for Children's Hospital and Homeless in Macon.
A movie theater more easily accessible to downtown.
Continue alley improvements for safety- restaurants/retail and pedestrians
The Dempsey
Invest more on the street where the Rookery is
New business like Dry Falls.
Improve the streetscape- plant trees. Better parking in this block.
Warehouse district can be a terrific area to be developed for businesses, etc.- connect the tunnel through terminal.
Clean up the Poplar St. medians to discourage the homeless community. This would encourage more people to visit those shops and restaurants.
Reroute trucks. Entrance pedestrian connection Marriott to Downtown. In GDOT plan- needed now.
Convert and rehab Dempsey to market-rate apartments/condos.
Former Bowen Bros breakfast/lunch wifi cafŽ cannot sell alcohol due to Board of Ed owner

Coliseum Drive/Second St. The gateway to downtown Macon is unattractive, uninviting. We need a mixture of residences and businesses. National retailers might invite more travelers to stop in and see what Macon has to offer. A super market in downtown area would be great for downtown inhabitants; it might also attract more locals downtown.
Large stable building at one of Macon's main entrances. We need to push this for re-use.
Activate our public spaces with art, music, and community!
Close intersection at Cherry and 4rd to create a plaza square for events.
Modern design single family homes. Macon is not a cookie cutter city so why keep building these style homes.
Old-fashioned ice cream parlor in old Joshua's Cup location called "Nutcracker Sweet."
Ask the folks who live at the Dempsey for some ideas. They've probably been here longer.
Walk-in movie theater. Brews and bar food. Grassy space to plop down and enjoy movies with friends & locals.
The blank lot (well, lots) need to become a small park or green space.

Build new Second Street Connector from Second Street over to Little Richard Penniman Blvd.  With new bridge over the railroad and neat pocket parks along the way- create vista of Downtown from railroad bridge.
More retail shops especially on Cherry Street. Clothes, gifts, jewelry, shoes. Like Ginger Michelle was at one time.
7th Street Truck Route. Get the log trucks off MLK Jr. Blvd.
Moe's. Chipotle.
Rail trail
Late night dining for college students! Go Bears!
I placed sticker on Poplar Mart, but I'd also like to see Dempsey disappear.
Add restrooms to the Macon Dog Park.
Tie Ft. Hawkins to Downtown (signage on I-16?) Link through Main St. Neighborhood
European Bakery and Coffee Shop serving wine also.
Pedestrian Bridge over the river from Central City Park to Walnut Creek and extension with trails into Ocmulgee Mounds National Historic Park.
Parking, destination shopping, better police presence
Rooftop restaurants/bars on Poplar St.
Musical Playground Instruments: Piano Keys & Wind Instruments. Set up for kids to play.
Bring back and MLB franchise minor league baseball team to Macon by remodeling/upgrading Luther Williams Field (worst sports loss ever was Braves going to Rome b/c we refused to do this)
Rooftop restaurants/bars on Poplar St.
A speakeasy on the corner of Washington and Orange. Light food and drinks.
Roof top restaurant. More greening (plants, trees, colorful flowers). Better parking.
Food, late night diner, grocery store, near by theater
Baseball field, hotel, and restaurant development.
Move Dempsey residents to another location. Landscaping city entryways.

A tapas bar/salsa club. I travel to ATL about once a month to go to a tapas bar called Luna Loca. It's a very fun environment restaurant and it turns into a salsa-dancing club after 8 pm. Live music and great food.
Rooftop restaurant. Allow small stores, i.e. craft shops, produce market, restaurants to develop along Riverwalk (Savannah style). Bridge it to fairgrounds.
Rooftop bar. Grand opera house. Events.
Multi-use development with a bridge for pedestrians.
More connected bike paths.
An open air amphitheater for musical performances and other productions. Make it attractive & contemporary architecture. Locate it in Tattnall Square Park or Washington Park.
More live music and free community events.
A downtown charter high school focusing on community development and civic engagemnt.
More big acts like Alice Cooper, Motley Crue, Kiss. Bring music back home. Not just southern rock, country & rap!
Small business loan fund
Longer crosswalk times
Dining area at Cherry and 3rd.

I added this to the website . . . I would sign and brand a bicycle corridor/route between Mercer University and Wesleyan College. Dannenburg Ave to Roff Ave to Brookdale to Naiper Ave to Forsyth Road to Tucker Road Trail. There are a couple of old rail spurs on Roff that need smoothing over and a tricky one-way section at Pio Nono. Along the way are several elementary schools that might qualify for some Federal / State Safe Routes to Schools money for sidewalk infrastructure as well. Freedom Park is another attraction. Naiper Ave. between Park St. and Forsyth has silly, wide bicycle lanes too. This is a reasonably good bang-for-our-buck project that needs little more than road signs. Of course, my dream is an ACTIVE RAIL and trail along that Norfolk Southern line. HWY 41 is a ridiculous GA bicycle route.
Christmas light all over downtown with Poplar Street having a Christmas light show going on every night during the holiday season. 2. Downtown security visible throughout the day!
Petting zoo please.
Remove Poplar Mart!

Anderson Park or Daisy Park entrance for Family of Patients Ronald McDonald House to have an outdoor space for lunch- also for Hospital employees. Park benches & trash/recycle cans- family needs to have an outdoor space to rejuvenate.
1. A movie theater 2. 2 Downtown Stadia for concerts and sporting events 3. Business development center
Doggie bag stations.
We should build a soccer stadium for a lower level soccer team. Greater than minor league. Player development league. Lots of soccer players in Macon and Warner Robbins.
More music and more free events for old people like myself.
I would love to see more live/work spaces for rent and sale in our urban core.
Ultimate frisbee and frisbee golf complex.
Improve green spaces. Increase green spaces.
Little Richard Almand Brothers Rock & Roll Blvd. (the whole street)
Water play area for Washington Park and Second Sunday or any day

IÕd like to see new energy in the industrial area. I live in the Broadway Lofts and I love seeing an old clothing factory being repurposed and brought back to life. Just behind that is an old warehouse converted into a new crossfit gym. I'd like to see more of this happen in these beautiful open abandoned vessels.
Green parking lot with new trees for the apartments across Mulberry St. Ln. from my dental office at 360 Spring St.

From the side yard of the Hay House one can see the flat roof and skylights on my office Holliday Dental Association. I would like to convert to a green roof. Aesthetics and maybe add attractive photo voltaic panels.

The one-way pains (Forsyth Street- Hardeman Avenue and Georgia Avenue from College St. to its intersection with Hardeman) need to be two-way so traffic will be reduced during peak hours. Retail does not prosper on one-way streets according to numerous studies. The high speed liveability of the area.
Roundabout at Georgia Ave, I-75, and Forsyth.
Fix sidewalks and improve lighting along College St. Especially between Hardeman and Ogelthorpe. BURY THE CABLES/LINES.
Do a major redevelopment including taking the interior of the block and creating a pond.
Contemporary high rise mixed use housing/retail parking deck.
Entrance to Ocmulgee National Monument from Clinton St. Connect this to the Riverwalk. Enhance Riverwalk.
Need bilboards at Harley Bridge and Bass Road directing people to Downtown.
Have businesses sponsor exit ramps for clean up.
Have the media stop referring to areas that are not in the Urban Core as "Downtown." As it relates to negative press, shootings, etc.
Hospitality training program- so tourists aren't driven away from Macon by its bas customer service. Peyton Anderson?
Historic & Architectural walking tour of downtown Macon
The connection between the Ocmulgee Trail proper and the piece of the trail inside the monument (Ocmulgee National Monument) needs to be reconfigured for feet and bikes.
A state of the art, world-class, geographical, cultural, historical museum with the primary exhibit space devoted to coastal plains Indian heritage
Bike repair stations.
Pedestrian bridge across the Ocmulgee/I-16.
Food truck rally. Lots of food!
CIGAR BAR/JAZZ LOUNGE. Add to an already rich musical culture that Macon already has.
Move and get rid of the homeless people hanging out. It makes people not want to come down.
Save Miller High School!
Finish up Poplar Street Development
Loft buildings with amenities.
Pedestrian-friendly alleys that connect a walkable, urban downtown to the Riverwalk.
Create an observation platform at Pinnacle Park in Second St. where old Boys Club used to be.
Create Mid-City Square at the intersection of Pine and Second to be an oasis of green in the ocean of asphalt that currently exists in South Downtown.
Reduce vehicle lanes on 1st Street between Plum and Cerry to two lanes. Create bicycle lanes.
Rooftop restaurants and bars.
3rd St: replace streetlights to better fit the architecture of the building on the street. Fix the sidewalks.
More off-street parking for the auditorium, Armory, Blacksmith Shop, Crazy Bull, and Government Center; plus, a new downtown hotel.
Gas station / urban market. Why?
Farmer's market
More support for student involvement in efforts downtown!
I would spend money to close Cherry St. between MLK & 2nd to make it fully pedestrian.
I would remake Grant's Loung to an upscale Bar and Grill performance venue.
Real Riverwalk connecting to Ocmulgee Monument
Tax free zones. More trash cans.
Ocmulgee Heritage trail/park/green spaces. Outdoor event venue. Enhance river park.
I would like to place emphasis on smaller neighborhood or pocket parks- simple measures to make them more inviting and enjoyable.
Ice cream shop
A real movie theater.
Continue the renovation of this block.
More parties downtown.

Ice cream shop, tapas restaurant, clothing stores, home goods/gift shop. Something similar to Cheaters on Ingleside or Haven. Beautify the streets and sidewalks. Intersection by Cotton Ave and Second St coming into the city is not very pretty. They used to have flowers where the statue is by Lawrence Mayer. Alley improvements, make it look pretty like what Taste and See did.
Change stop light at Riverside at Spring going north so you can turn left to go toward Hay House that would help traffic for tourists not to have to find an indirect route.
More outdoor entertaining areas - eating and drinking. Get rid of the Poplar Mart! Remove the Dempsey people!
Downtown Dog Park
2 dollar movie theater in the Old Bibb Theater
Amici Italian CafŽ.
Chick-Fil-A!
Downtown. Clubs, restaurants, and live entertainment.
Connect Downtown to Central City Park/the Riverwalk coherently via bikes and pedestrians.
Macon needs: a comprehensive, state of the art municipal recycling facility with a strong environmental education component for creating an informed and enthusiastic recycling community.
Band stage.
Tapas restaurant on Poplar St.
In Belgium, there is a small space- they sell frittes (French Fries). Awesome shop!

The small dog section of the Macon dog park needs to be fixed. I can't bring my dogs there anymore since they added the additional agility equipment. My dogs can get out of the gate and added fence. They are 10 and 7 lbs.! Please fix!
Downtown trolley from Intown Macon to Downtown.
Downtown trolley from Midtown.
Julian's Sports Bar & Gym.
Second Street Gentlemen's Club/Cabaret.
Pita Pit.
An Annex to the Mounds. A Native American cultural center.
Outdoor fitness facility similar to Piedmont Park in Atlanta or on a much larger scale, Muske Beach in Santa Monica. This could also go in at Amerson Park.
Quicker response for pedestrian walk signal at intersection
Turn the old Egyptian Temple (across from City Hall and St. Joseph's) into a bowling alley / roller rink / arcade.
More restaurants. Small cafes. Music in the parks. City square.
Develop small restaurants and shops along Riverfront. Public pool (indoor and out) downtown.
More dollars for better-maintained parks and green space.
Starbucks, yogurt shop
I think building more hotels, restaurants, shopping areas, etc. around Mercer's campus would really help the city.
I would add more businesses downtown, especially sweets, like froyo & cupcake places.
A nice, outdoor shopping and leisure area similar to Atlantic Station in Atlanta could be more iniviting and provide entertainment
Add more nightlife places downtown for young adults.
I would spend money on more publicizing of the Riverwalk as well as increasing attractiveness of the walk.
Rooftop bar & restaurant. A FedEx or UPS closer to downtown. Take down Poplar Mart.
Have more coffee shops where individuals could study and also more shopping buildings. Starbucks.
More outdoor seating for restaurants.
Splash pad in Tattnall Square Park or Downtown
Dangerous intersection. Need RR crossing guards that come down.
Restaurant Row-focused downtown recruitment of North Macon business
Bring gift & apparel shops to downtown- Do not need restaurants or more bars. Specialty stores, ice cream shop, shoe store
Well kept planters- suspended or at ground level contracted with a plant business for up keep. Very welcoming.
Create a safe environment for those who want to enjoy nightlife. Advertise new jobs/places so that people know they are there.
Wifi within the core
Dog Park!
Our most popular tourist attraction should be surrounded by a great neighborhood.
Indor/outdoor baby through 12 year old child playground/cafŽ that is suitable for birthday parties as well.
Food incubator/accelerator for food startups
Get rid of the unsightly second-hand/thrift stores populating the downtown shopping area, and encourage more upscale shopping to move in.
Hotel
Remove Poplar Mart at 500 block of Poplar and start (or move) Farmer's Market.
I walk all over downtown and my two biggest problems are a lack of shade and traffic signals that are not pedestrian friendly. I would plan more trees and do a pedestrian study.
Waterslides.

Intelligent planned design. Convert alleys to pedestrian/bike-friendly with lighting/clean space/and smooth pedestrian-friendly surfacing. Connect river all the way to Mercer with these pedestrian pathways.
PFLAG Chapter Downtown
Riverside shopping/dining.
Parking meters on Cherry St. More connection between Mulberry and Cherry. Improve walkability in between Rookery, Downtown Grill, Tokyo Alley.
Downtown maps on corners with updated listings, menus, shop items, etc.
Revival in the industrial district with mixed-use (living, office, restaurant, retail, etc). Need to take advantage of proximity to city's largest park.
On Poplar. Increase green space. Remove gravel and excess concrete.
Free public transit downtown
Bike rider discounts at local stores. Friday bike day, 10% off.
Outdoor pop-up concert events downtown!
Skate Park. BMX track.
Bowling Alley & Arcade
Virtual reality cafŽ. A cafŽ in which a customer can enjoy virtual interaction as well as enjoy a beverage and other refreshments.
Farmer's market (daily)
More greenery on downtown walking spaces!

Turn this entire area fronting the river into a lush passive park. Build a tunnel/esplanade over the RR tracks to afford a great vista of the river. This will re-connect the city to the river again- farther toward Rotary Park could have a limited restaurant/entertainment presence.
God bless America. In a better environment for kids to stay drug free and air polluted free. Free Willy. Our animals as well. Better people's places n thing.
Make more pedestrian-friendly

Allow busking style musicians to play in specific areas (either first come first served or by schedule). Spend money for electricity for a small amp and electric instruments. Acoustic musicians can play anywhere that doesn't bother businesses. Don't call the cops on them. All musicians might not appeal, but audiences will come down and spend money and musicians may move up to play venues. All down Cherry, 3rd, 2nd, etc.
Improve the plantlife and water filtration system

As a college student, nightlife social hubs attract me downtown; whether it's late night food options, clubs, or more loungesÉ anything to replace the vacant storefronts between 2nd and 3rd street intersections of Cherry Street
Welcoming entrance at Coliseum Convention Center. More updated guardrails.
Music venues. Dive bars. Green space. More restaurants without having the chain status.
Make the Ocmulgee more prominent in Downtown.
Cycle rickshaws. Individuals would rent rickshaws for nominal fee- 4, 6, or 8 hours. Renters would work for tips.
Fix up and reopen Bibb Theater.
Extend and enhance park all the way to the river over RR tracks.
Downtown needs another grocery store (with affordable prices).
Redevelop Poplar Street! Redevelop the streets in the Downtown area following the original design. Business, entertainment, etc.

Roundabouts. Remove 8 stoplights at each: Third and Poplar, Third and Cherry, Third and Mulberry
Cool urban space

Green space yes.
Plant beautiful plants w/flowers in planters along Cherry Street.
REMOVE POPLAR MART!

Help rehab the former Ramada Plaza hotel.
Add more businesses downtown that would have more options for food in the downtown area.
Better bars and eating for college students.
More restaurant options in Mercer Village.
More family-friendly things to downtown at night.
Bring back high speed rail. Macon to Atlanta.
Public transportation for the Macon Airport. With direct flights to other cities.
There needs to be more restaurants such as an ice cream shop. There needs to be more foot traffic.
1st and 2nd Street have nice restaurants and coffee shops. There needs to be a focus to shut down automobile traffic on weekends and focus on foot traffic.
I placed my sticker on Tattnall Square Park because I think it holds a lot of potential to host many more events. Money could be used to help landscape as well as hold sporting events.
More parks. Include disc golf courses.
More bike lanes and pedestrian walkways.
Boutique Hotel.
Rapid transit- Terminal Station. Macon would see immediate growth with rapid transit system between Atlanta and Savannah. Growth would include retail, housing, recreation attractions, etc.
Movie theater and restaurants.
Wi-fi cafŽ
More places to shop/eat
Create more shopping area for a younger crowd.
More downtown nightlife like bars or restaurants for a younger crowd.
Clean up downtown, not just loft area. Paint buildings. Make them look less rundown and more inviting.
More parking.
Solar Farm
A bus system for Alexander II Elementary School.
Downtown needs to be revitalized to include more shops/boutiques and restaurants.
Safer for nightlife. Late night food. Better crosswalking.
Maintain the horticulture while also finding more creative uses for the space like holding community bonding events. Possibly even adding a track for walking/running (aside from the sidewalks).
Make downtown cleaner and more appealing to the younger adults.
More security.
ADD human being restroom to Dog Park. Please and thank you.
Public restrooms as found in San Francisco- self-sanitizing.

A new entrance area to the Indian Mounds. With people exiting the interstate and the Marriott/Coliseum Corridor drawing potential visitors, a clearly defined and attractive entrance would draw more people to this local treasure.

Less loud rap music on Cherry Street. Make Cherry Street a pedestrian plaza with only rubber tired trolleys allowed with free rides from Cotton Ave to Terminal Station and back. NYC did it in Times Square too. Great success!

Divert the homeless and vagrants outside of the downtown area by basing soup kitchens outside of the downtown area. Macon is currently drawing the homeless to areas we are trying to develop and attracting tourists and others with money.
More trees!
instead of building a ball park.  i would like to see a family entertainment complex. bowling, huge arcade, lazor tag,  lazor maze, rental go karts, skating ring  & nice restaurant.
properties.name: coliseum drive across from centreplex

properties.description: a soap box pernament facility  it would b a first for GA.  also place a skate park & bmx track there.
properties.name: riverside @ new street

properties.description: Whenever I go walking around downtown, I have to go all the way to the Marathon station for a bottle of water and a stick of gum.  When I finally get to move downtown (I'm trying to get there!) I will have to go to Kroger on Pio Nono for groceries.  There should be a few small grocery and dollar stores scattered about downtown - all within walking/biking distance.  Get some small grocery stores like Aldi's, and some small convenience stores like Dollar General's downtown.  You can make ordinances to make them look 'right' for downtown.
properties.name: Multiple Locations Downtown

comments.comment: there is a small grocery store ocmulgee traders on popular street.

properties.description: add hanging plants to light posts. These can be watered by drip irrigation at very low cost but would add to the aesthetic appeal of our downtown
properties.name: throughout the downtown area

properties.description: Cherry Street needs more parking.
properties.name: Cherry Street Macon

properties.description: Very UNFRIENDLY welcome to Macon. After driving this way once a week, I got sick of it. We've got to do something about abandoned buildings on MLK, the Main Street of Macon from Warner Robins and the Robins AFB.
properties.name: MLK

properties.description: We have the 2nd Street Project to revitalize 2nd Street and everything and that's great. What about Riverside Drive? It could use some sprucing up. :-) I could use some development.
properties.name: Riverside Drive

properties.description: We need the planned I-16/I-75 Interchange. The current one has so many accidents and its also very hard to get over in time from i-75 South to Exit 1A on I-16. Connect 2nd Street to I-16 East. I think it would really help Downtown.
properties.name: I-16/I-75 Interchange

properties.description: Macon as a whole, the area needs mass transit. It needs a line that goes from Geico to Bass Road, Zebulon Road, Lake Tobo, and of course include downtown in this. We need to connect Downtown through transit to other areas of town. Other cities are becoming more transit oriented. Macon needs to follow. Look at the transit oriented development at Lindbergh Center in Atlanta. Macon could get that. Riverfront development could be based off transit. Give Downtown stations near the courthouse/grand opera house, terminal station, riverfront, poplar and 3rd, plum and 2nd, and MED center.
properties.name: Mass Transit

properties.description: Downtown needs transit. I think 2nd Street is a great place to start.
properties.name: 2nd Street Streetcar

properties.description: Get the ground cleaned up so we can get some development
properties.name: Renaissance on the River

comments.comment: Yes! Let's get on with it!
I agree this site need to be clean so  a development can get started. I would love to see this project come back to life with a mixed used high rise building.

properties.description: ZipCar needs to be installed along the transportation corridor, within walking distance of the Terminal Station.  Access to transportation is a must in Macon - extending this access to those who cannot afford a car is vital to continued economic growth.
properties.name: 5th Street

comments.comment: Yes! Let's add Zipcar! My husband currently doesn't have a car and the ability to rent a car for a few hours would be great!
I agree. This is a great idea. I love Zipcar from being in Atlanta.

properties.description: Commuter rail is a necessity.  You cannot have a vibrant, alive, downtown area without passenger trains to take people out of the area for work and back into the area for spending money.
properties.name: Terminal Station

properties.description: Dave and Busters, or any other Family fun center complete with restaurant and activities for kids of all ages.  Capitol Theater showing movies after main theater releases them.  Maybe have reduced fee theater.  Also Capitol Theater could show scary movies every week in month of October 2014 and show family movies every week December 2014.  Make the cost attractive for families.  For Christmas bring Santa Claus downtown for the kids ...for pictures etc....
properties.name: downtown Macon (Cherry Street, Second Street, Third Street areas.

comments.comment: i would love to see something like dave & busters downtown.  if we cant get that why not a bowling alley, with a huge game room, lazor tag,  lazor maze,  nice restaurant.  i would put something like this on riverside where the macon transit used to be. or across from the centreplex instead of building a ball park

properties.description: How about an oil refinery?
properties.name: In the River

properties.description: A Playground area that would be fenced in enough with an attractive latch able gate so that parents could bring their children to play downtown and socialize. Should be convenient to shopping/eating... Would be great in the area near ocmulgee  traders. Parents could grab a sandwich and drinks and picnic at the playground while children play. Could bring more people to the area.
properties.name: Not entirely sure... Poplar area or Cherry street area?

properties.description: While this idea extends beyond the urban core, any future planning for alternative transportation routes connecting Downtown Macon with the rest of the city is vital. While a few spots would require infrastructure improvements, much of this route only needs signage, branding, and someone with a broom. From Tatnall Square Park, under I-75, to Roff, Napier, to Forsyth Rd. This can then connect to the Tucker Road multi-use path.
properties.name: Mercer University to Wesleyan College Greenway

properties.description: This entire space is one big cluster fart.  A gated off "splash pad" filled with sharp edged concrete pillars that can never be counted on to be operational.  Oh, and did I mention? It's literally in the middle of a street!  This is a beautiful space with good bones that a true urban planner/landscape design group should be able use in a much better way.  To me, more green is a must here.  Think Central Park at Atlantic Station Atlanta.  They even use fake grass there!  Shade trees and some retail/food in bottom of the Tubman, Sports HoF would be great.  Also those commercial spaces between the Tubman and old children's museum/lofts are super important to this space and are really an ugly waste right now.  This space would make a great incubation space but not in the most commonly understood sense.  The Seaside neighborhood in Florida has a progression their business work through before they get to brick and mortar store front.  Start with a cart, then move to a semi permanent tent, then move to shared space, then move to dedicated storefront.  We have all the elements to do something like this here.  I have attached a photo of Central Park, Atlantic Station that shouldn't look completely crazy or impossible to anyone.
properties.name: Cherry Street Plaza

properties.description: Downtown has experienced a remarkable rennaisance lately, please keep it up.  some ideas _ landscape our gateways and maintain them, fix sidewalks, establish better trash cans, better signage, landscape downtown sidewalks, fix alleys, light them, Dempsey?????, 3rd street park - clean up. Ambassadors to help visitors and locals find places. get log trucks off MLK. thanks for asking......
properties.name: Cherry, 3rd, 2nd, Poplar, gateways

properties.description: One of the things I would like to see downtown is something that I see in many neighborhoods (including cities such as Atlanta, Athens, and Milledgeville), retail, namely boutiques.  Little Five Points in Atlanta is a cross section between 4 neighborhoods.  While it has several great restaurants and bars, it also has a ton of unique retail including places such as Junkman's Daughter, Criminal Records, Wax-N-Facts, and The Clothing Warehouse.  These retail establishments are what brought people into the neighborhood.  I lived a stones throw away from the heart of Little 5 for years and 90% of the people who would flock to the neighborhood did not live there, however they would visit for the retail and end up stooping at the restaurants during their visit.
properties.name: All throughout downtown

comments.comment: lawrence meyer, bibb music, cokes camera, golden bough, tailsspin, rader's, andersens, the vault, cherry street cycles, robinson home, bert maxwell, union furniture, dot's, pink chief, posh, old school records, fresh produce records, georgia market house, regional shopping, fashion avenue, on time fashion, macon fashion, fashion 365, kaybee, blair's and blair's too, barnes furs, macon cents, the willow tree, jonathan's, embellished wedding... the retail exists. where are the shoppers?

properties.description: Indoor gym and sporting facility. Racket ball rooms, basketball courts, weights, treadmills etc.
properties.name: Downtown

properties.description: Retail incentives for bike riders; Saturday bike discounts at stores.
properties.name: Central Business District

properties.description: Update the basketball courts. Some good lights and new rims should do the trick.
properties.name: Daisy Park

properties.description: Tables, umbrellas,  concerts. Let's make this a pedestrian focused intersection - no automobiles!
properties.name: Third and Cherry

properties.description: For most, the Spring Street bridge is the unofficial welcome to the Ocmulgee River, yet one of the least visually appealing places.  Incorporate better landscaping along the bridge and into the riverwalk park that makes the river more inviting.
properties.name: Boat Ramp at Spring Street

properties.description: Public restrooms and water fountains would be a welcome addition to the downtown.
properties.name: Various locations

properties.description: Enforce the "no left turn" sign! It is dangerous to pedestrians and backs up traffic horrendously. I have never once seen any enforcement of this traffic law though.
properties.name: 2nd/Mulberry

comments.comment: Now that the market has moved to Tatnall Square it seems like a great spot to me.  More parking.  More space for the vendors.

While I love the Wednesday Market on Mulberry it is destroying the park in front of the Courthouse.  I suggest moving the market to the paved area of Poplar Street.  More parking, less traffic issues for those needing to conduct business in the Court House, & no damage to green space.

properties.description: More walkable and more shade
properties.name: MLK BLVD and Spring Street

comments.comment: incorporate landscaping into Macon's entry points

properties.description: A crosswalk with a lighted signal would be extremely helpful at this location. It is nearly impossible to cross Georgia Ave. in the morning if you are coming from downtown without going all the way up to the light at College and then back down.
properties.name: Georgia Ave @ Mercer Law

properties.description: Make it a plaza, not a parking lot.
properties.name: Cherry St Plaza

comments.comment: The water fountain is such a beautiful addition that people do not know about.  Is this meant to be something that kids could play/splash in?  If so, some group needs to host a get-together to promote this great addition to our city.  Also, it is so beautiful at night!

properties.description: Have all the unoccupied store fronts clean the trash out of the windows or put up screens so that it isn't visible from the sidewalk.  When I see trash in their windows it makes the area look bad and is unattractive.  This is a simple fix!
properties.name: All un-occupied store fronts

properties.description: Provide a screen wall behind the existing large shade trees across from the Capricorn studios to shut off views of the city hall parking lot and create the urban feel that existed when buildings lined both sides of this historic street.
properties.name: Along DT Walton SR Way

properties.description: Playground with 100% accessible play areas, allowing participation by Children's Hospital kids.
properties.name: Daisy Park

properties.description: Despite the failure of the Music Hall of Fame, Macon has a great potential in conserving and capitalizing on its music heritage; Save Capricorn Studios!
properties.name: Historic Capricorn Recording Studios

properties.description: This is an unsafe intersection that has no pedestrian facilities. Sight distances are difficult. Makes for an uninviting entrance to Riverside.
properties.name: Riverside Drive/Madison Street

properties.description: This cemetery campus/nexus is a great waterfront asset for the region!
properties.name: Riverside Cemetery/Rose Hill Campus

properties.description: ice cream shop
properties.name: Cherry Street

comments.comment: I've said this for a while!  A great after-school destination to get kids in the area!

properties.description: Add a pavilion for events.
properties.name: Rosa Parks Square

properties.description: Make 2nd Street two lanes only, with angled parking
properties.name: 2nd Street

properties.description: More green and shade, add some games to play.
properties.name: Poplar Park
